meanings.definition: Bazzing (verb): to make a buzzing or humming sound
meanings.sent1: The bees were bazzing around the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The old refrigerator was bazzing loudly in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The bumblebee was bazzing happily as it collected nectar.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the air was bazzing like a live wire.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the cicadas bazzing in the trees filled the summer evening.

meanings.definition: Bazzing (adjective): characterized by a buzzing or humming noise
meanings.sent1: The bazzing fan provided a cool breeze on the hot day.
meanings.sent2: The bazzing mosquito was annoying everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The bazzing sound of the fan put me to sleep in no time.
meanings.sent4: The bazzing excitement in the air was contagious.
meanings.sent5: The bazzing background noise of the city was ever-present.

meanings.definition: Bazzing (noun): a buzzing or humming sound
meanings.sent1: The constant bazzing of the cicadas filled the forest.
meanings.sent2: The soft bazzing of the bees was soothing to the ears.
meanings.sent3: The bazzing of the old radio added a retro vibe to the room.
meanings.sent4: The bazzing of the crowd at the concert was like a symphony.
meanings.sent5: The distant bazzing of the cars on the highway could be heard faintly.
